botan.cert.x509.x509path

X.509 Cert Path Validation

License:
Botan is released under the Simplified BSD License (see LICENSE.md)

struct PathValidationRestrictions;
Specifies restrictions on the PKIX path validation

this(bool require_rev = false, size_t key_strength = 80, bool ocsp_all = false);
Params:
bool require_rev if true, revocation information is required
size_t key_strength is the minimum strength (in terms of operations, eg 80 means 2^80) of a signature. Signatures weaker than this are rejected. If more than 80, SHA-1 signatures are also rejected.
bool ocsp_all where to use all intermediates

this(bool require_rev, size_t minimum_key_strength, bool ocsp_all_intermediates, RBTreeRef!string trusted_hashes);
Params:
bool require_rev if true, revocation information is required
size_t minimum_key_strength is the minimum strength (in terms of operations, eg 80 means 2^80) of a signature. Signatures weaker than this are rejected.
bool ocsp_all_intermediates where to use all intermediates
RBTreeRef!string trusted_hashes a set of trusted hashes. Any signatures created using a hash other than one of these will be rejected.

struct PathValidationResult;
Represents the result of a PKIX path validation

const RBTreeRef!string trustedHashes();
Returns:
the set of hash functions you are implicitly trusting by trusting this result.

const X509Certificate trustRoot();
Returns:
the trust root of the validation

const ref const(Vector!X509Certificate) certPath();
Returns:
the full path from subject to trust root

const bool successfulValidation();
Returns:
true iff the validation was succesful

const CertificateStatusCode result();
Returns:
overall validation result code

const ref const(Vector!(RBTreeRef!CertificateStatusCode)) allStatuses();
Return a set of status codes for each certificate in the chain

const string resultString();
Returns:
string representation of the validation result

PathValidationResult x509PathValidate()(ref const Vector!X509Certificate end_certs, auto ref const PathValidationRestrictions restrictions, ref const Vector!CertificateStore certstores);
PKIX Path Validation

PathValidationResult x509PathValidate()(in X509Certificate end_cert, auto ref const PathValidationRestrictions restrictions, ref const Vector!CertificateStore certstores);
PKIX Path Validation

PathValidationResult x509PathValidate()(in X509Certificate end_cert, auto ref const PathValidationRestrictions restrictions, in CertificateStore store);
PKIX Path Validation

PathValidationResult x509PathValidate()(ref const Vector!X509Certificate end_certs, auto ref const PathValidationRestrictions restrictions, in CertificateStore store);
